column4: kodac?  Need to check open printing.org to see if they have support
what happens when you try to print a test page?
do you have permissions for lpadmin?
check your group settings via terminal, i.e. type "groups" and post them
those are good.  Open up the printer properties and click on Policies
let me know when you have policies dialog open
tell me what you see
do you see an icon representing your printer?
right click the icon for the printer
by chance is this a wireless printer?
which configuration do you want to use?  USB or wifi?
will they both be using wifi?
cool
these are desktop computers of laptops?
before going on, what's the name of the print driver it is using?
can you get to "preferences" "printers".. oh wait, you are running regular ubuntu?
I'm running a cousin of Ubuntu, so I may be looking at something different
can you get to the add printers dialog?
what do you see in Device URI?
what do you see for make and model?
I think that is the problem
the openprinting.org website shows drives for ESP 3, ESP 3250 ESP 5250 ESP 5500 ESP 6150 ESP 7 and ESP7250 ESP9
are any of those close to your version printer?
weird
you have its wifi turned on and a USB plugged in at the same time?
is the USB hooked to the computer you want to use via wifi?
its better to try one config at a time
now from the wifi computer you see in printer properties the IP address
what's it show for make and model?
do you have cups in installed?
you could try setting up the printer via webbrowser and use cups
basically you open your browser and in the address type "localhost" and it should bring up the cups webpage
from there you can add the printer
does the printer even make any sounds?
can you see the print que?  Sometimes they need to be cleaned out of failed jobs
that is really weird
how about turning it off for 5 seconds and then back on
no error lights or messages shown on the printer?
yes
weird.  You don't have a neighbor with the same printer do you?
lol that would be funny
did you use this driver?  c2espinstaller.sh
try installing with a C310 driver
c2espinstaller.sh is more automatic, just choose C310
you will want to delete the printer from your previous attempts on each computer
then try the linked one
if you download c2espinstaller.sh, right click it, then properties and make it executible
are you finding the driver?
still updating?
I gotta go for a while, but will check back in about an hour and a half
you could not use the 2cespinstaller.sh ?
you have to make the .sh file executible
find it via your file manager, right click on it and choose properties, make executible
its right click, properties, permissions
find the c2espinstalle.sh file via your file manager, right click, choose Properties, then Permissions and make executible, then you can double click its name and it will run
I really gotta go, please try  my last post before this one.  Be back later.
